main event: An oval-shaped object was observed by ground radar and visual sighting in Canton, Ohio in November 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 minutes.
The object changed directions during the observation.
The object's length was approximately 1.5 to 2 times its width.
The object could not be conclusively identified as a balloon or aircraft.
Further analysis was planned to be included in a monthly UFOB (Unidentified Flying Object) Summary.
witnesses: civilian Ground Observer Corps (GOC) and ground radar
